quotes.quote: A kind heart is a fountain of gladness, making everything in its vicinity freshen into smiles.
The heart of a mother is a deep abyss at the bottom of which you will always find forgiveness.
It is only with the heart that one can see rightly; what is essential is invisible to the eye.
Nobody has ever measured, not even poets, how much the heart can hold.
The human heart has hidden treasures, In secret kept, in silence sealed; The thoughts, the hopes, the dreams, the pleasures, Whose charms were broken if revealed.
If you find it in your heart to care for somebody else, you will have succeeded.
Whatever your heart clings to and confides in, that is really your God.
A loving heart is the beginning of all knowledge.
A gentle heart is tied with an easy thread.
The heart has its reasons of which reason knows nothing.
The heart's memory eliminates the bad and magnifies the good.
A loving heart is the truest wisdom.
The joyful heart sees and reads the world with a sense of freedom and graciousness.
The heart will break, but broken live on.
The mother's heart is the child's schoolroom.
A heart can no more be forced to love than a stomach can be forced to digest food by persuasion.
If you go deeper and deeper into your own heart, you'll be living in a world with less fear, isolation and loneliness.
You do have to follow your heart, otherwise you're living a false life.
A heart well prepared for adversity in bad times hopes, and in good times fears for a change in fortune.
A woman's heart is a deep ocean of secrets.
And the heart that is soonest awake to the flowers is always the first to be touch'd by the thorns.
The human heart, at whatever age, opens only to the heart that opens in return.
An offended heart is the breeding ground of deception.
There are strings in the human heart that had better not be vibrated.
Whatever it is your heart desires, please go for it, it's yours to have.
There never was any heart truly great and generous, that was not also tender and compassionate.
When the heart speaks, its language is the same under all latitudes.
The less you open your heart to others, the more your heart suffers.
Don't worry about your heart, it will last you as long as you live.
A noble heart cannot suspect in others the pettiness and malice that it has never felt.
